DOC.brief_summary: The investigators main objective is to show that OSNA technique is as accurate as pathological analysis (frozen section / HE staining and immunochemistry) to detect occult lymph node metastasis (micro and macrometastasis).
DOC.brief_title: One-step Nucleic Acid Amplification for Detecting Lymph Node Metastasis of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
DOC.criteria: Patient > 18 years old Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma diagnosed by biopsy N0 classification (N0: no lymph node invasion on clinical and radiological examination). Neck dissection or sentinel lymph node biopsy required to treat the patient ECOG 1,2 or 3 Patient's consent Patient previously treated by radiotherapy or surgery for head and neck neoplasm. Contraindication or patient unwillingness to undergo surgical treatment Incapacitated adults
